IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: To sponsor, operate and maintain a long-term residential, "continuing care" community for the aged.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The mission of Vantage House is to establish, sponsor, manage, and maintain a long-term care residential community for the aged with on-site nursing and other health care, and to carry out the care, treatment, and habitation of the elderly and infirm.
IRS990.Description: Residential & Wellness Care:Supported independent living with dining and recreation and social support programs

Activity2.Description: Health Care:24 hour nursing and health care spanning three levels of care with all supporting programs

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Casualty Gain: 1105835. RECLASS REALIZED LOSS ON PROPERTY: 215764.
SETTLEMENT EXPENSE: 562000. RECLASS REALIZED LOSS ON PROPERTY: 215764.

The Corporation is a not-for-profit corporation as described in Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code and is exempt from federal income taxes pursuant to Section 501(a) of the Internal Revenue Code. The Corporation follows the provisions of the income tax standard regarding the recognition and measurement of uncertain tax positions. The application of these provisions has no impact on the Corporation's financial statements. The Corporation is not aware of any activities that would jeopardize its tax-exempt status or of any activities that are subject to tax on unrelated business income or excise or other taxes. The tax returns for the years 2006 to 2009 are open to examination by federal and state authorities. The Corporation has implemented processes to ensure corporate compliance with the Internal Revenue Service intermediate sanctions provision. These processes include retention by the Board of Directors of an unbiased third party consultant to review executive compensation practices, annual review by the Board Compensation Committee of executive team compensation, and annual review by the Board of Directors of the performance and compensation of the Corporation's Executive Director. The Board engages in annual corporate compliance education, has adopted and reviews at least annually a written corporate compliance program and code of conduct, and has a detailed conflict of interest policy.

Form990ScheduleKPartI.DescriptionOfPurpose: finance capital improvements, to advance refund, and to establish reserves

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: Executive Director - Employed by Life Care Services
Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: management fees are paid by Columbia Vantage House Corporation to Life Care Services.Salary and benefits received from Life Care Services was 167,195.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 3
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Company has a Management Agreement with Life Care Services LLC of Des Moines IA (LCS). LCS provides systems (clinical, financial), support, compliance, and places on-site the Executive Director (who acts as the Chief Operating Officer) and the Administrator (who is required to be a Maryland licensed Nursing Home Administrator) and provides regular reports to the Board of Directors.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Form 990 will be distributed to the Board prior to filing and be given an online link to the Form and schedules as filed.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Conflict of Interest Policy applies to all employees and Board Members. Annual conflict of interest disclosures are required of all board members. All employees are required to review and acknowledge in writing the conflict of interest policy upon hire and annually. Any conflict of interest disclosed or potential conflict of interest is reviewed by the Executive Director, and at their discretion, forwarded for consideration to the Executive Committee of the Board.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Compensation for key employees is reviewed annually by the Board of Directors, and is based on salary and wage surveys conducted by Hospital and Healthcare Compensation Service (hhcsinc.com). Columbia Vantage House also utilizes resources from Lifespan, AAHSA, and organizations such as the Society for Human Resource Management (SHRM). The compensation for the Executive Director and Administrator is under the control of the management company and set in conjunction with the Board of Directors Executive Committee. Compensation and other benefits are reimbursed to the management company, LCS, in the management fees.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Columbia Vantage House provides the governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements available upon request.
PROCESS FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE. This process has not changed from the prior year.

Form990ScheduleRPartII.PrimaryActivities: A supporting organization for Columbia Vantage House Corporation.
